title: The wounds of an enemie in the house of a friend. Being a relation of the hard measure sustained by Miles Halhead, and Thomas Salthouse, for the testimony of Jesus: particularly in a long, and sore, and close imprisonment, first at Plymouth, and then at Exeter in the county of Devon, though they have neither offended the law of God, or of the nation. Published for the clearing of their innocency from the cloud of transgression, of which they are supposed highly guilty, and by reason of their silent abiding such sharp, and long, and cruell sufferings.
author: Halhead, Miles, 1613 or 14-1689 or 90.
publisher: Printed for Giles Calvert at the Black spread-Eagle, near the west end of Pauls,
notes: Annotation on Thomason copy: "March. 21"; also the last number of the imprint date has been marked through.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
